intro: Hicorius acuminata, commonly known as the sharp-pointed hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to red. The plant has heart-shaped leaves with a smooth texture and a woody stem that becomes more prominent as it matures. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Hicorius acuminata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
